alert.note: Alert for Kennebec (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 9:15PM EST until December 21 at 6:17PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Maine... Kennebec River At North Sidney affecting Kennebec County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kennebec River at North Sidney. * WHEN...Until Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 31.0 feet, Flood waters over Route 201 south of the Bay Street Bridge in Winslow, where businesses are surrounded. At least three feet of water north of the Bay Street Bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 31.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Thursday afternoon and continue falling to 13.6 feet early Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
